VmUpBwProbe, VmUpBwTotalProbe

    public interface Probe<ValueType>
extends Notifier
    A probe is used to access and watch modifications on a given information (value of the probe).
    Each probe has an associated Key that defines what information it contains, and uniquely identifies it inside its parent.

    A probe must be initialized using setup(Probed) after it is created to be usable.
    And, when the probe is not needed anymore, the discard() should be called. The probe will then perform all necessary cleanup.

    This interface extends the Notifier interface.
    You can watch probe value changes by adding a listener for the appropriate notification code (CoreNotificationCodes.PROBE_VALUE_CHANGED).

    As a design recommendation, the value of the probe should directly depend on the parent of the probe. In particular, when the parent of the probe is an Entity, then the value of the probe should be computed independently from the parent of that Entity.
    The value of the probe, can however depend on the children of that Entity.

    Another design recommendation is that probe implementations should register all necessary listeners to update their value automatically. Thus, they should not rely on explicit updates from external code. For instance, their value should not be updated through other entities or probes.
    Nevertheless, such implementations may exist in some use case (as they may result in better performances), the probe should then implement the ModifiableProbe interface.

    Since:
    1.0

      • getKey

        String getKey()
        Returns a key that defines what kind of information this probe contains. The key is case sensitive and also uniquely identifies this probe inside its parent.
        Returns:

        void setup(Probed parent)
        Setups the probe and sets its parent to the given one.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the probe is not discarded (and thus has already a defined parent)

      • isDiscarded

        boolean isDiscarded()
        Returns true if this probe was discarded.
        Returns:
        true if this probe was discarded
        See Also:
        discard()

      • discard

        void discard()
        This method discards and performs cleanup on this probe.

        After calling this method, this probe is not usable anymore in the sense that no value change notifications are thrown, and any call to getValue() will throw an exception.
        If you want to use the probe again you need to call setup(Probed) on the probe.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the probe is already discarded
        See Also:
        isDiscarded()
